sections.heading: What is 〜ないと?
sections.content:
〜ないと is a casual way to express necessity or obligation, meaning "I have to," "I must," or "if I don't." It's short for ないといけない or ないとダメ.

もう行かないと "I have to go now" (lit: If I don't go...) 勉強しないと "I have to study" (lit: If I don't study...) 早く寝ないと "I have to sleep early" (lit: If I don't sleep early...)

children.heading: Pattern: Verb ない-form + と
children.content: | Verb | ない-form | + と | | ------ | --------- | ---------- | | 行く | 行かない | 行かないと | | 食べる | 食べない | 食べないと | | する | しない | しないと | | 来る | 来ない | 来ないと | | 読む | 読まない | 読まないと | | 寝る | 寝ない | 寝ないと |

children.heading: Common forms
children.content: 行かないと - Have to go 食べないと - Have to eat しないと - Have to do 勉強しないと - Have to study

children.heading: ないといけない (Have to)
children.content: 行かないといけない "I have to go" 勉強しないといけない "I have to study" Standard form

children.heading: ないとダメ (Have to - casual)
children.content: 行かないとダメ "I have to go" 早く寝ないとダメだよ "You have to sleep early" Very casual

children.heading: ないと alone (Casual shortcut)
children.content: もう行かないと "I have to go now" Ending implied Most casual

children.heading: Expressing necessity
children.content: 宿題をしないと "I have to do homework" 明日早いから、寝ないと "Tomorrow is early, so I have to sleep" ダイエットしないと "I have to diet"

children.heading: Casual reminders to self
children.content: 買い物に行かないと "I have to go shopping" メールを返信しないと "I have to reply to emails" 準備しないと "I have to prepare"

children.heading: Warnings to others
children.content: 早く起きないと、遅れるよ "If you don't wake up early, you'll be late" 勉強しないと、落ちるよ "If you don't study, you'll fail" 急がないと！ "You have to hurry!"

children.heading: Very casual
children.content: Used with: ✓ Friends ✓ Family ✓ Self-talk ✓ Diary/notes Not for: ✗ Boss ✗ Customers ✗ Formal situations

children.heading: Often incomplete
children.content: Full: 行かないといけない Short: 行かないと The ending is understood Very natural in casual speech

children.heading: Shows urgency
children.content: もう行かないと！ "I really have to go now!" Implies "or else something bad"

children.heading: Example 1: Leaving
children.content: A: もう帰るの？ "You're going home already?" B: うん、明日早いから、寝ないと "Yeah, tomorrow is early, so I have to sleep" A: そっか。気をつけてね "I see. Be careful"

children.heading: Example 2: Reminding
children.content: A: 明日テストだよ "The test is tomorrow" B: やばい！勉強しないと！ "Oh no! I have to study!" A: 頑張ってね "Do your best"

children.heading: Example 3: Self-reminder
children.content: A: あ、もうこんな時間だ "Oh, it's already this time" B: 本当だ。そろそろ行かないとね "Really. We should go soon"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using in formal situations
children.content: Too casual to boss: 行かないと ⚠️ Better: 行かなければなりません ✓ "I must go" Use formal forms at work!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong negative form
children.content: Wrong: 行くないと ❌ Right: 行かないと ✓ "I have to go" Use ない-form correctly!

children.heading: Mistake 3: Overusing with strangers
children.content: Too casual: 勉強しないとダメですよ ⚠️ Better: 勉強したほうがいいですよ ✓ "You should study" ないと is for casual contexts

sections.heading: ないと vs Other Necessity Forms

children.heading: ないと - Most casual
children.content: 行かないと "Gotta go" Friends, family, self

children.heading: なきゃ - Very casual
children.content: 行かなきゃ "Gotta go" Even more casual

children.heading: ないといけない - Casual-polite
children.content: 行かないといけない "I have to go" Slightly more complete

children.heading: なければならない - Formal
children.content: 行かなければならない "I must go" Formal situations

children.heading: もう～ないと
children.content: もう行かないと "I have to go now" もう寝ないと "I have to sleep now" Adds urgency

children.heading: ～ないとダメ
children.content: 勉強しないとダメだよ "You have to study" ちゃんと食べないとダメ "You have to eat properly" Casual warning

children.heading: ～ないといけない
children.content: 早く起きないといけない "I have to wake up early" 薬を飲まないといけない "I have to take medicine" More complete form

children.heading: Reminding yourself
children.content: あ、メール返さないと "Oh, I have to reply to the email" 買い物行かないと "I have to go shopping" 宿題やらないと "I have to do homework" Common in inner monologue

children.heading: Casual warnings
children.content: 急がないと、遅れるよ "If you don't hurry, you'll be late" 早く寝ないと、明日辛いよ "If you don't sleep early, tomorrow will be tough" ちゃんと食べないと、元気出ないよ "If you don't eat properly, you won't have energy"

children.heading: なくちゃ (なくては)
children.content: 行かなくちゃ "Gotta go" Similar to ないと Very casual

children.heading: なきゃ (なければ)
children.content: 行かなきゃ "Gotta go" Super casual Most contracted

children.heading: Comparison
children.content: Most complete: 行かなければならない ↓ 行かなければいけない ↓ 行かないといけない ↓ 行かなくちゃ ↓ 行かなきゃ ↓ Most casual: 行かないと

children.heading: Time pressure
children.content: もう時間だ。行かないと！ "It's time. I have to go!" 締め切りが近い。終わらせないと "The deadline is close. I have to finish"

children.heading: Health/lifestyle
children.content: 運動しないとな "I have to exercise" ダイエットしないと "I have to diet" 早く寝ないと "I have to sleep early"

children.heading: Responsibilities
children.content: 宿題しないと "I have to do homework" 掃除しないと "I have to clean" 仕事しないと "I have to work"

children.heading: ～ないとな
children.content: 勉強しないとな "I really should study" 頑張らないとな "I really have to try hard" Self-reflection

children.heading: ～ないとね
children.content: そろそろ行かないとね "We should go soon" 準備しないとね "We have to prepare" Shared understanding

children.heading: ～ないと、～
children.content: 勉強しないと、落ちるよ "If you don't study, you'll fail" 食べないと、痩せちゃうよ "If you don't eat, you'll lose weight" Shows what happens if you don't

children.heading: When you need to be polite
children.content: Casual: 行かないと Polite: 行かなければなりません Casual: しないとダメ Polite: しなければいけません Casual: 勉強しないと Polite: 勉強しなければなりません

children.heading: Common in casual texting
children.content: ごめん、もう行かないと！ "Sorry, I have to go now!" 宿題やらないと... "I have to do homework..." 寝ないと〜 "I have to sleep~" Very natural in texts

children.heading: ～ないとまずい (It's bad if I don't)
children.content: 早く行かないとまずい "It's bad if I don't go quickly" 報告しないとまずいな "It's bad if I don't report"

children.heading: ～ないとやばい (It's bad if I don't - slang)
children.content: 勉強しないとやばい "I'm in trouble if I don't study" 急がないとやばい！ "We're in trouble if we don't hurry!" Very casual/slang

children.heading: Should have done
children.content: もっと勉強しないとダメだった "I should have studied more" 早く寝ないといけなかった "I should have slept early" Past regret

children.heading: Basic
children.content: もう行かないと "I have to go now" 勉強しないと "I have to study" 寝ないと "I have to sleep"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 明日早いから、そろそろ帰らないと "Tomorrow is early, so I have to go home soon" 試験が近いから、本気で勉強しないとやばい "The exam is close, so I'm in trouble if I don't study seriously" 健康のために、もっと運動しないとダメだな "For my health, I really have to exercise more"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: このままじゃダメだ。生活習慣を見直さないと。 早寝早起きして、ちゃんと三食食べないと。 運動も始めないとな。 "This won't do. I have to review my lifestyle. I have to go to bed early and wake up early, and eat three meals properly. I have to start exercising too." 仕事も大事だけど、家族との時間も 大切にしないと。バランスを取らないと、 人生後悔することになるかもしれない。 "Work is important, but I also have to cherish time with family. If I don't balance, I might regret my life."

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜なければならない - Must (formal) 〜なきゃ - Have to (very casual) 〜なくちゃ - Gotta (casual) 〜といけない - If not, it's bad 〜とダメ - If not, it's no good Necessity expressions - Expressing obligation

children.heading: Company
children.content: About Pricing Blog Contact

children.heading: Legal
children.content: Privacy Policy Terms of Service Cookie Policy

examples.sentence: 〜といけない - If not, it's bad
〜とダメ - If not, it's no good
